clusters.title: Denmark warns of 'fundamental disagreement' after White House talks on Greenland

items.title: Denmark warns of 'fundamental disagreement' after White House talks on Greenland
items.standfirst: There was no major breakthrough during the meeting, and President Trump reiterated his interest in acquiring the island shortly afterwards.
items.content: There was no major breakthrough during the meeting, and President Trump reiterated his interest in acquiring the island shortly afterwards.

items.title: CNBC Daily Open: Gold and silver pop over geopolitical turmoil, including U.S.-Denmark rift over Greenland
items.standfirst: Top officials from Greenland, Denmark and the U.S. met at the White House Wednesday to discuss Washington's controversial bid to assert ownership over Greenland. The session ended without an agreement, reflecting what Danish Foreign Minister Lars Lokke Rasmussen called a "fundamental disagreement"…
items.content: Top officials from Greenland, Denmark and the U.S. met at the White House Wednesday to discuss Washington's controversial bid to assert ownership over Greenland. The session ended without an agreement, reflecting what Danish Foreign Minister Lars Lokke Rasmussen called a "fundamental disagreement"…

items.title: A look at the strategic importance of Greenland as Trump escalates threats
items.standfirst: President Trump said that he hoped for a resolution on his threat to annex Greenland. But disagreements remain following Vice President Vance and Secretary of State Rubio meeting with the foreign ministers of Denmark and Greenland at the White House. Amna Nawaz discussed the latest with Rob Bauer,…
items.content: President Trump said that he hoped for a resolution on his threat to annex Greenland. But disagreements remain following Vice President Vance and Secretary of State Rubio meeting with the foreign ministers of Denmark and Greenland at the White House. Amna Nawaz discussed the latest with Rob Bauer,…

items.title: Greenland and Denmark say Trump set on ‘conquering’ territory after meeting
items.standfirst: Danish Foreign Minister Rasmussen says meeting with Trump administration 'didn't manage to change' US position.
items.content: Danish Foreign Minister Rasmussen says meeting with Trump administration 'didn't manage to change' US position.

items.title: Trump insists Greenland is crucial for national security after Denmark talks
items.standfirst: Talks fail to solve ‘fundamental disagreement’ over Arctic island controlled by CopenhagenDonald Trump reiterated on Wednesday that the US needs Greenland and that Denmark cannot be relied upon to protect the island, even as he said that “something will work out” with respect to the future governance of the Danish overseas territory.The remarks, which came after a high-stakes meeting between US, Danish and Greenlandic officials, indicate that fundamental differences remain between how Washington, Copenhagen and Nuuk see the political future of the island. Continue reading...
items.content: Talks fail to solve ‘fundamental disagreement’ over Arctic island controlled by CopenhagenDonald Trump reiterated on Wednesday that the US needs Greenland and that Denmark cannot be relied upon to protect the island, even as he said that “something will work out” with respect to the future governance of the Danish overseas territory.The remarks, which came after a high-stakes meeting between US, Danish and Greenlandic officials, indicate that fundamental differences remain between how Washington, Copenhagen and Nuuk see the political future of the island. Continue reading...

items.title: Denmark warns of 'fundamental disagreements' over Greenland after White House talks
items.standfirst: The UK has deployed a military officer to Greenland as Denmark and its European allies seek to counter Donald Trump's threats to take the territory, after talks at the White House ended with "fundamental disagreement".
items.content: The UK has deployed a military officer to Greenland as Denmark and its European allies seek to counter Donald Trump's threats to take the territory, after talks at the White House ended with "fundamental disagreement".

items.title: France to send troops for European security mission to Greenland amid Trump threats
items.standfirst: France and Germany announced Wednesday they will deploy troops to Greenland as part of a European security mission, following renewed threats by US President Donald Trump to take control of the Arctic island. The move, made at Denmark’s request, comes after high-level talks in Washington involving US, Danish and Greenlandic officials.
items.content: France and Germany announced Wednesday they will deploy troops to Greenland as part of a European security mission, following renewed threats by US President Donald Trump to take control of the Arctic island. The move, made at Denmark’s request, comes after high-level talks in Washington involving US, Danish and Greenlandic officials.

items.title: US, Denmark and Greenland to form Arctic working group after tense talks
items.standfirst: ‘Fundamental disagreement’ remains as Donald Trump maintains his campaign to take over the territory
items.content: ‘Fundamental disagreement’ remains as Donald Trump maintains his campaign to take over the territory

items.title: Denmark says there's a 'fundamental disagreement' with Trump over Greenland
items.standfirst: The two sides agreed to create a working group to discuss ways to work through differences as President Trump continues to call for a U.S. takeover of Denmark's Arctic territory of Greenland.
items.content: The two sides agreed to create a working group to discuss ways to work through differences as President Trump continues to call for a U.S. takeover of Denmark's Arctic territory of Greenland.(Image credit: John McDonnell)

items.title: Danish FM says US ‘conquer’ of Greenland not acceptable
items.standfirst: Denmark’s foreign minister said his government opposes Donald Trump’s clear desire to “conquer” Greenland.
items.content: Denmark’s foreign minister said his government opposes Donald Trump’s clear desire to “conquer” Greenland.

items.title: Why Greenland? Trump ups pressure as Denmark dispatches top diplomat
items.standfirst: No Oval Office made-for-TV drama as U-S vice president JD Vance joined U-S Secretary of State Marco Rubio and the foreign ministers of Greenland and Denmark. We'll ask about renewed pressure by the Trump administration on Copenhagen to hand over that Arctic dependency.
items.content: No Oval Office made-for-TV drama as U-S vice president JD Vance joined U-S Secretary of State Marco Rubio and the foreign ministers of Greenland and Denmark. We'll ask about renewed pressure by the Trump administration on Copenhagen to hand over that Arctic dependency.

items.title: Danish official cites 'fundamental disagreement' with US over Greenland after White House meeting
items.standfirst: Greenland and Denmark on Wednesday said they “agreed to disagree” with US diplomats after a “frank, constructive” discussion at the White House on US President Donald Trump’s desire to acquire the autonomous territory.
items.content: Greenland and Denmark on Wednesday said they “agreed to disagree” with US diplomats after a “frank, constructive” discussion at the White House on US President Donald Trump’s desire to acquire the autonomous territory.

items.title: Greenland and Denmark officials meet with Vance and Rubio
items.standfirst: The foreign ministers of Denmark and Greenland met Vice President JD Vance and Secretary of State Marco Rubio amid President Donald Trump's push to take control of the Arctic island. NBC News' Garrett Haake reports on the meeting's outcome and the officials' current stance regarding Greenland.
items.content: The foreign ministers of Denmark and Greenland met Vice President JD Vance and Secretary of State Marco Rubio amid President Donald Trump's push to take control of the Arctic island. NBC News' Garrett Haake reports on the meeting's outcome and the officials' current stance regarding Greenland.

items.title: Denmark seeks 'common way forward' on Greenland after meeting with Trump officials
items.standfirst: Denmark will join a high-level working group to discuss Greenland's future after talks at the White House with senior Trump administration officials
items.content: Denmark will join a high-level working group to discuss Greenland's future after talks at the White House with senior Trump administration officials

items.title: Musk’s xAI restricts Grok image editing following global concerns over sexualized images
items.standfirst: Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence company xAI said late on Wednesday it imposed restrictions on ‍all ​users of its Grok AI chatbot that limit image editing after the service produced sexualized images that sparked concerns among global regulators. “We have implemented technological measures to…
items.content: Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence company xAI said late on Wednesday it imposed restrictions on ‍all ​users of its Grok AI chatbot that limit image editing after the service produced sexualized images that sparked concerns among global regulators. “We have implemented technological measures to…

items.title: xAI restricts Grok chatbot after sexualised AI images spark global concern
items.standfirst: Elon Musk’s AI company xAI has imposed limits on its Grok chatbot’s image editing capabilities after hyper-realistic sexualised images — including depictions of minors — circulated online. The restrictions apply to all users, including paid subscribers, and block image generation in jurisdictions where such content is illegal.
items.content: Elon Musk’s AI company xAI has imposed limits on its Grok chatbot’s image editing capabilities after hyper-realistic sexualised images — including depictions of minors — circulated online. The restrictions apply to all users, including paid subscribers, and block image generation in jurisdictions where such content is illegal.

items.title: Musk’s X to block Grok AI tool from creating sexualized images of real people
items.standfirst: Amid global backlash, billionaire had only hours earlier said he was not aware of any ‘naked underage images’Elon Musk’s xAI has announced it will block the ability of its Grok AI tool to alter images of real people to put them in “revealing clothing such as bikinis”, amid a global backlash over the tool being used to generate explicit imagery.The move came just hours after the billionaire said he was was not aware of any “naked underage images” made by Grok. Continue reading...

items.title: California attorney general investigates Musk’s Grok AI over lewd fake images
items.standfirst: AI tool made by Elon Musk’s xAI makes it easy to harass women with deepfake images, says state’s top attorneyCalifornia authorities have announced an investigation into the output of Elon Musk’s Grok.The state’s top attorney said Grok, an AI tool and image generator made by Musk’s company xAI, appears to be making it easy to harass women and girls with deepfake images on X and elsewhere online. Continue reading...

items.title: Musk’s xAI Faces California AG Probe Over Grok Sexual Images
items.standfirst: Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence startup, xAI, is under investigation by the California attorney general’s office after the company’s Grok chatbot was allegedly used to create thousands of sexualized images of women and children without their consent.
items.content: Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence startup, xAI, is under investigation by the California attorney general’s office after the company’s Grok chatbot was allegedly used to create thousands of sexualized images of women and children without their consent.

items.title: Senate Republicans block Venezuela war powers resolution
items.standfirst: The resolution would have forced President Trump to get authorization from Congress before launching military operations in Venezuela. It was blocked after having previously advanced with GOP support.
items.content: The resolution would have forced President Trump to get authorization from Congress before launching military operations in Venezuela. It was blocked after having previously advanced with GOP support.(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)

items.title: US Senate defeats war powers resolution designed to rein in Trump
items.standfirst: Only three Republicans joined with Democrats to vote in favour of the resolution, resulting in a tie broken by JD Vance.
items.content: Only three Republicans joined with Democrats to vote in favour of the resolution, resulting in a tie broken by JD Vance.

items.title: US Senate kills resolution that would have limited Trump action in Venezuela
items.standfirst: Republicans Josh Hawley and Todd Young flipped after receiving ‘assurances’ from Trump administrationUS politics live – latest updatesThe US Senate has voted against a war powers resolution that would have prevented Donald Trump from taking further military action against Venezuela without giving Congress advance notice.Senators Josh Hawley of Missouri and Todd Young of Indiana, who had joined three other Republicans to advance the resolution alongside Democrats last week, flipped after they said they received assurances from the Trump administration. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

clusters.title: NASA conducts first-ever medical evacuation from space station
clusters.neutral_headline: NASA conducts first-ever medical evacuation from space station

items.title: NASA conducts first-ever medical evacuation from space station
items.standfirst: NASA carried out its first medical evacuation from the International Space Station after an astronaut required care, bringing four crew members back to Earth earlier than planned. The early return temporarily reduces the station crew, limiting spacewalks until a replacement team arrives.
items.content: NASA carried out its first medical evacuation from the International Space Station after an astronaut required care, bringing four crew members back to Earth earlier than planned. The early return temporarily reduces the station crew, limiting spacewalks until a replacement team arrives.

items.title: Astronauts head home early after medical issue
items.standfirst: Crew 11 is expected to splash down off the coast of Southern California at 3:41 a.m. ET, closing out a 167-day stay in space.
items.content: Crew 11 is expected to splash down off the coast of Southern California at 3:41 a.m. ET, closing out a 167-day stay in space.

items.title: Nasa astronauts begin 'bittersweet' medical evacuation from space station
items.standfirst: The crew is expected to splash down off the coast of California in the early hours of Thursday local time.
items.content: The crew is expected to splash down off the coast of California in the early hours of Thursday local time.

items.title: Astronauts evacuate space station over 'serious medical condition'
items.standfirst: Four astronauts are buckling up for an unexpected return from the International Space Station (ISS) after one of them suffered a "serious medical condition".
items.content: Four astronauts are buckling up for an unexpected return from the International Space Station (ISS) after one of them suffered a "serious medical condition".

items.title: Trump Says Iran Killings Have Stopped, Executions of Protesters Won't Take Place | WSJ News
items.standfirst: Speaking at the White House, the president appeared to downplay the chance of imminent military action against Tehran.
items.content: Speaking at the White House, the president appeared to downplay the chance of imminent military action against Tehran.

items.title: What's next in Iran after Trump says killing of protesters "has stopped"
items.standfirst: President Trump says his administration has been notified that the killings and executions of anti-government protesters in Iran have stopped. CBS News Middle East reporter Courtney Kealy has more.
items.content: President Trump says his administration has been notified that the killings and executions of anti-government protesters in Iran have stopped. CBS News Middle East reporter Courtney Kealy has more.

items.title: Trump suggests military action may not be needed in Iran
items.standfirst: After a week's worth of threats against the Iranian regime, President Trump now suggests military action may not be necessary. According to the president, the executions of protesters have been called off. CBS News' Elizabeth Palmer and Charlie D'Agata report.
items.content: After a week's worth of threats against the Iranian regime, President Trump now suggests military action may not be necessary. According to the president, the executions of protesters have been called off. CBS News' Elizabeth Palmer and Charlie D'Agata report.

items.title: H.R. McMaster suggests Iran is trying to run "an information operation" to "postpone a U.S. strike"
items.standfirst: President Trump on Wednesday said his administration had been informed that "the killing in Iran is stopping." Mr. Trump's statement comes with thousands believed to be dead in the wake of anti-government protests. Former Trump national security adviser H.R. McMaster joins with analysis.
items.content: President Trump on Wednesday said his administration had been informed that "the killing in Iran is stopping." Mr. Trump's statement comes with thousands believed to be dead in the wake of anti-government protests. Former Trump national security adviser H.R. McMaster joins with analysis.

items.title: 'Now there's the threat of executions' in Iran
items.standfirst: An Iranian security official says 2,000 people have been killed so far after a crackdown on weeks of anti-government protests.
items.content: An Iranian security official says 2,000 people have been killed so far after a crackdown on weeks of anti-government protests.

items.title: Iranian death toll reaches 2,000, rights group says, as Trump tells protesters 'help is on the way'
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump urged Iranian civilians to keep protesting and said “help is on its way” Tuesday amid a crackdown on anti-government demonstrations that a U.S.-based human rights group says has killed 2,500 people
items.content: President Donald Trump urged Iranian civilians to keep protesting and said “help is on its way” Tuesday amid a crackdown on anti-government demonstrations that a U.S.-based human rights group says has killed 2,500 people

clusters.title: U.S. to suspend immigrant visas from 75 countries over public assistance concerns
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump administration to suspend immigrant visa processing for 75 countries

items.title: U.S. to suspend immigrant visas from 75 countries over public assistance concerns
items.standfirst: The State Department says it will suspend the processing of immigrant visas for citizens of 75 countries whose nationals are deemed likely to require public assistance while living in the United States.
items.content: The State Department says it will suspend the processing of immigrant visas for citizens of 75 countries whose nationals are deemed likely to require public assistance while living in the United States. (Image credit: Ramon Espinosa)

items.title: Trump administration to suspend immigrant visa processing for 75 countries
items.standfirst: US State Department says freeze will affect citizens of Somalia, Haiti, Iran and Eritrea, among other countries.
items.content: US State Department says freeze will affect citizens of Somalia, Haiti, Iran and Eritrea, among other countries.

items.title: US suspends immigrant visa processing for 75 countries
items.standfirst: The US on Wednesday said it was issuing a blanket suspension of immigrant visa processing for applicants from 75 countries including Russia, Iran, Brazil, Egypt, Thailand, Nigeria and Somalia. The freeze will begin on January 21 with no set time for it to end.
items.content: The US on Wednesday said it was issuing a blanket suspension of immigrant visa processing for applicants from 75 countries including Russia, Iran, Brazil, Egypt, Thailand, Nigeria and Somalia. The freeze will begin on January 21 with no set time for it to end.

items.title: US to suspend immigrant visa processing for 75 countries
items.standfirst: The US is suspending the process for immigrant visas from 75 countries, the Department of State said on Wednesday.
items.content: The US is suspending the process for immigrant visas from 75 countries, the Department of State said on Wednesday.

clusters.title: US launches phase two of Gaza peace plan with new technocratic government
clusters.neutral_headline: US launches phase two of Gaza peace plan with new technocratic government

items.title: US launches phase two of Gaza peace plan with new technocratic government
items.standfirst: It includes the establishment of a technocratic Palestinian government, as well as the reconstruction and demilitarisation of Gaza, US envoy Steve Witkoff says.
items.content: It includes the establishment of a technocratic Palestinian government, as well as the reconstruction and demilitarisation of Gaza, US envoy Steve Witkoff says.

items.title: US announces start of second phase of Gaza ceasefire
items.standfirst: No details given of committee members who will run territory but they are expected be technocrats, not politiciansThe US has announced the start of the second phase of the Gaza ceasefire, including the creation of a committee of Palestinian technocrats who are supposed to take over the day-to-day running of the territory for a transition period.The announcement was made on social media by Donald Trump’s special envoy, Steve Witkoff, but it lacked any detail or names of potential members of the proposed “national committee for the administration of Gaza”. The committee is not expected to begin work until mandated by a “peace board” chaired by Trump, which has yet to be created. Continue reading...
items.content: No details given of committee members who will run territory but they are expected be technocrats, not politiciansThe US has announced the start of the second phase of the Gaza ceasefire, including the creation of a committee of Palestinian technocrats who are supposed to take over the day-to-day running of the territory for a transition period.The announcement was made on social media by Donald Trump’s special envoy, Steve Witkoff, but it lacked any detail or names of potential members of the proposed “national committee for the administration of Gaza”. The committee is not expected to begin work until mandated by a “peace board” chaired by Trump, which has yet to be created. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump's Gaza peace plan enters second phase
items.standfirst: The United States will push forward with the next phase of its plan for peace in Gaza, moving toward "demilitarization, technocratic governance, and reconstruction," President Donald Trump's special envoy Steve Witkoff said Wednesday
items.content: The United States will push forward with the next phase of its plan for peace in Gaza, moving toward "demilitarization, technocratic governance, and reconstruction," President Donald Trump's special envoy Steve Witkoff said Wednesday

items.title: US launches phase two of plan to end Gaza conflict, including creation of transitional authority

items.title: Immigration agents shoot man in Minneapolis as tensions in city run high
items.standfirst: Minnesota city says it’s aware of a shooting as residents continue to reel in aftermath of Renee Nicole Good’s killingFederal immigration agents shot a man on Wednesday evening during an enforcement action in Minneapolis, according to multiple sources in networks of legal aid and observer groups.In a statement posted online, the city of Minneapolis said it was aware “of a shooting involving federal law enforcement in north Minneapolis” and was working to confirm additional information. What led to the shooting and the identities of those involved have not yet been released. Continue reading...
